dialogues.ABEL:
[1]Ready? 
[2]You look very nice. 
[3]You sure? 
[4]We don't have any more money so what else could I do. 
[5]
[6]Really? 
[7]You've been telling me not to do this for a year. 
[8]I'm sorry? 
[9]Almost two. 
[10]I have been looking over my fence at this property for a very long time. 
[11]No... I imagine I want it for the same reason you did. 
[12]To grow. 
[13]No. 
[14]I like to own the things I use. 
[15]So. 
[16]I understand. 
[17]I understand. 
[18]It's not ours yet. 
[19]There he is. 
[20]You have done a beautiful job here. 
[21]I mean it. You and your men should be very proud. 
[22]Most people don't have anything beautiful like this to show for their day's work. You are a lucky man. 
[23]Well I thank you... my family will be very happy here. 
[24]Now I think I owe you some money. 
[25]It is. 
[26]This is the seventeen outstanding. But we are arriving here in four days. It must be done. 
[27]Well, I'll let you go. 
[28]And the tile in the master bath... 
[29]Thank you. 
[30]Have they found the truck? 
[31]Are you alright? 
[32]Have the police been here yet? 
[33]Can you speak? 
[34]Yes. 
[35]Yes. 
[36]
[37]To you as well. 
[38]These fucking guys. This poor kid has been working his ass off. 
[39]No...don't talk to him or your father. 
[40]It won't. 
[41]I'm meeting with the D.A. in the morning. 
[42]No we are not. 
[43]Well I'm not. 
[44]Yes. 
[45]I have to get going. 
[46]Can we get you anything? 
[47]We'll pick you up when they let you out of here. 
[48]These men are cowards. Too weak to make a living... or even fight with their own hands, and too stupid to think up anything else to do. 
[49]May I take it? 
[50]May I take it now? 
[51]Yes. 
[52]So you guys have done what you needed to? 
[53]And what was that? 
[54]You just said you've done what you needed to... so what was it that you've done? 
[55]Did you fingerprint or anything? 
[56]So you've done nothing. 
[57]So who's coming? 
[58]They stole the $6,000 of fuel that was in it. 
[59]My people are at risk just driving around in this city, just trying to do their jobs. And I... I have done everything you have asked of me. It's been two years since you first started investigating my company and I have spent thousands of dollars hiring lawyers for this and that to provide you with every piece of information your office has requested. And I expect that you have been asking the same from my competitors. So with all this information that you have gained... We are just asking if you have any idea who has been doing this to us? 
[60]First, please know that we respect the work you are doing to try to help our business and the city. But also know I have never taken anything I haven't earned from anyone so when you say you've... 
[61]We are on the same side here. 
[62]Well, it makes a difference to me. 
[63]Yes. 
[64]I understand. 
[65]You have your job to do. But know that you are wrong and that we will take advantage of every opportunity to prove that. 
[66]I'm sorry? 
[67]Yes? 
[68]I am always trying to expand my business. 
[69]Every new market is a difficult market. 
[70]But my driver was assaulted and my truck and oil were stolen in broad daylight in front of fifteen toll collectors and six police officers yesterday. And yet no one saw anything. That is a problem... no? 
[71]I'm sure you do. 
[72]Exactly. 
[73]I know. 
[74]The DA... He said he's going to bring down charges on us next week. 
[75]We don't know yet. 
[76]Right now they are just saying us. 
[77]Where are we exposed? 
[78]Anna? 
[79]Okay. 
[80]I'm very sorry this happened. Do you need anything else?  If you do, you call the office... Okay then. 
[81]I don't. 
[82]You will. 
[83]Yes. They took the load. 
[84]Seventh... you get some rest. 
[85]Arnold. 
[86]What's that? 
[87]We are working on it. 
[88]We are, thanks for your concern. 
[89]Really? When was that? 
[90]It's possible. 
[91]Yes. 
[92]It is. 
[93]Any new market is a tough one. I'll see you. 
[94]A toast. 
[95]A toast to our new home. It's as beautiful as my wife and daughters and as strong as me... May we be happy, prosperous and safe here. Cheers. 
[96]Peter... it's official as of yesterday. 
[97]Yes. 
[98]That's possible. 
[99]He's from Ohio. Played football. I like my drivers to fit in with the neighborhood... 
[100]Just picked up a few new accounts over there. Weekend houses of some old clients from in the city. 
[101]Right there. 
[102]Thank you. 
[103]Proud? 
[104]It's not set up yet... So I am guessing this isn't good news here on a Sunday night. 
[105]That describes many people at this point. 
[106]How bad? 
[107]Where are we exposed? 
[108]A couple places? 
[109]Anna... Anna! 
[110]As of tomorrow I'll have my new radio hooked up though so you should be able to reach me wherever I am... 
[111]Where are we exposed? 
[112]What does that mean? 
[113]How far? 
[114]Anna? 
[115]Okay. 
[116]Thank you. 
[117]Who? 
[118]Okay. 
[119]Quiet... don't worry. It's nothing. 
[120]Quiet. It's nothing. Come down here. 
[121]Go. Oh come on. Go. 
[122]A lot of help you were. 
[123]What do you mean, how am I supposed to know who it was? 
[124]I don't know. 
[125]I think it was just some punk, looking to rip us off. 
[126]Ouch! If they had wanted to send a message he could have... and he didn't. 
[127]Please. Don't get going on this. We are a big new house. He probably wanted the TV. He didn't have a gun, he had nothing. The alarm will be in on Monday. It was some kid. They aren't coming back. 
[128]What you are looking for here is the opening to the burn chamber. Now at this point you have not tipped your hat in anyway. From the minute you walked in the house you should have been working to create an impression of total impartiality. But now... 
[129]When this door opens you begin to close. It must always be spotless. If they see you have ever done this before it is over. 
[130]Now, you do this and only this... You look down at the cloth and don't say a word... You just keep staring at the cloth and then you slowly just start shaking your head. Very very slowly and small. 
[131]Don't look up at them. Just at the cloth. 
[132]It means you are close... Then after sitting in silence way longer than is comfortable, you turn. And say "I'd love to run a few numbers for you. Is there somewhere more comfortable we could sit." They will almost always take you to the dining room table and will offer you something. And whatever it is you always take the fancy option. 
[133]A tea please. 
[134]I'd love a lemonade, thank you. 
[135]Because, we are never going to be the cheapest option, so we have to be the best. And they want... no, need... to feel that you want the best too. That's why our trucks are the newest or cleanest, and our drivers are approachable. 
[136]I gotta go, but the final point I will make is the hardest one. Once you have done the math and shown them what we can save them over the long haul through proper maintenance, you need them to sign. And the problem is by hiring you that means they are firing someone else. And that's never easy. So to get them over the line you need to close them. So when you show them the number look up at them both... and just stare at them... 
[137]You stare longer than you should. Because this is not a joke. You will only keep this job if you close. And that's not funny to you. And I am only interested in this company growing, and when it isn't I don't think it's funny at all. These people work very hard for their money and these other guys are ripping them off, treating them poorly, because they don't know... so when you look them in the eye you have to believe that we are better, and we are, but you will never do anything as hard as staring a person straight in the eye and telling the truth. 
[138]Well... it was great to meet you. Welcome and I wish you luck. 
[139]Good morning. First off, I picked up Julian yesterday and he is back home and doing much better. And I just wanted to make sure you are all aware that we are doing everything we can to deal with this situation. We are working with law enforcement, and they seem to be closing in on these guys. But, sadly these are the times we are living in and we must rise above them. So, on that front we have these. 
[140]These will be in every truck by the end of the week. Much to my wife's concern I spent some serious coin and we now have our own closed channel that shouldn't have any blackout areas. You will always be in contact with us. (a hand goes up in the 
[141]We have been in constant contact with the union and they aren't considering any new course of action at this time. 
[142]Yes. 
[143]What is that? 
[144]Where did you get it? 
[145]Let me see that. I'll take care of this. 
[146]I don't know, but I will take care of it. 
[147]I know what it is! 
[148]Let me deal with this. 
[149]You are not to tell your father about this. 
[150]Do you hear me. 
[151]I don't know. 
[152]That truck just went out filthy. 
[153]How much? 
[154]You need to get home and start going through our set of books. How far back are they going? 
[155]What is O'Leary doing here?. 
[156]Jesus. 
[157]How are you Bill? 
[158]I would have come to see you. 
[159]My guys. 
[160]Good. I would love you to help on this. Because I can't have it going on any longer either. 
[161]I respectfully disagree. 
[162]They are taking shots at me because I am growing, expanding, getting stronger not weaker. 
[163]Well, it appears that you can't. 
[164]I agree. But these are truck drivers, not soldiers, this will lead to chaos. 
[165]No, it won't. 
[166]Yes. 
[167]It may seem that way... but if you are weak eventually it will show... it always does. And if you want this to all be behind us, help me find out who is doing this. You know a lot of people, and that would be the most help to me. 
[168]I'm sure that's true. 
[169]Thank you for coming Bill. 
[170]I know. 
[171]Leo. 
[172]Yes. 
[173]I know. 
[174]I said I wouldn't do it. 
[175]What's that? 
[176]Are you really serious with this, this is what it's come to, walking around outside like fucking gangsters? 
[177]I must? 
[178]These men, they work for me. These trucks they drive, the customers they serve. They are here because we built this. 
[179]What are you even talking about here? 
[180]These men are fucking truck drivers. This is insane. You know who is gonna get it in the end here, me. This comes back to me. 
[181]I'm not doing it. 
[182]It will be the end of everything I have worked for. If one of these guys shoots somebody it's me they will bring down for it...I'll talk to him... And we need to close this deal. We can't stay like this any longer. We must close on that property... We are so weak right now. 
[183]Because I have my entire savings at risk with this deposit. It is everything. 
[184]I don't know. 
[185]I've thought about it every day for the last five years. This place was sitting over that fence mocking.... 
[186]I don't know what you mean. 
[187]I know what you are asking and no... I never ask myself why I do this. It just feels right... wanting to be bigger feels better. It feels right. 
[188]Yes... 
[189]...It is. 
[190]Only when necessary. 
[191]A lot. 
[192]A wine list please. 
[193]We've been better... but we are good. 
[194]But you should know Arthur that this man has been digging through our industry for over two years looking for anything he can find. And as you know probably better than anyone, having worked with some of our competitors the thought that he would have singled us out is ridiculous. It reeks of everything that is wrong with this city right now. We run a fair and clean business and follow every standard industry practice and I will fight `til my last day to prove that... 
[195]But... but... 
[196]...Don't think for a moment that I am going to allow this mess to interfere with our plan to grow. We need to know you are standing by us. 
[197]That's a very good question. This property gives us many things... firstly direct access to the river. So I can bring in fuel directly from any provider in the world straight to my tanks, then it has over 10 million gallons of storage capacity, so I can buy in the summers when my price is low and sell to my customers and most importantly some of my competitors when the price is high. I won't just drive trucks anymore... I will control my fate... but the real answer to your question... 
[198]... is that when it feels scary to jump Ian... that is exactly when you must jump... or you risk ending up staying in the same place your whole life... and that I can't do. 
[199]Yes. Arthur is a good man. 
[200]Of course. 
[201]Are you okay? 
[202]Jesus. 
[203]No. 
[204]I know. 
[205]Getting the tire iron! 
[206]What? 
[207]Are you kidding? 
[208]Okay then... what is this gun? 
[209]Where did you get it? 
[210]Do you have a permit? 
[211]You must be a bigger fucking idiot than I even thought. You are trying to protect your children? Protect them? Do you have any idea what happens if you get caught using that thing? 
[212]You dress yourself up in these fancy clothes, and look at you here in your mansion. I've given you everything you could possibly want but you still can't stop thinking like the Brooklyn corner-store gangster's daughter that you are. 
[213]Where is this thing? Let me see it. 
[214]Let me see it. Is this going to make you safe? 
[215]You know who uses guns like this? Whores! 
[216]It's a trap... and you are walking right into it... You need to get that thing out of our house. 
[217]That is what I'm doing. 
[218]I understand. But as you can see this is a terrible time for us. I am having my daughter's birthday party. 
[219]I'm going to kill this guy. 
[220]Abel. 
[221]Give me five minutes. 
[222]Maria. Keep the kids playing for a few minutes. 
[223]Bring the last few out. 
[224]What's going on out there. 
[225]Do we even need to be doing this? What exactly are we hiding here? 
[226]Is that the last one. Get back out there. 
[227]Hey, how are you? 
[228]You'll do great. Remember... When you get them there. Hold the eye contact longer than you would like... but you watch what happens. 
[229]Good luck. 
[230]It is good to see you back here. You look good. 
[231]Are you ready to get back to work? 
[232]You are. 
[233]Where are you heading? 
[234]Manhattan. That's a cakewalk. 
[235]Good... Because you are. We all are. Someone came to my house a couple nights ago to rob me... 
[236]I tried to chase them away... but really there's nothing I can do. I am vulnerable. We all are. They can come back tonight. But to succeed and be great you must keep going back. And I know what all these guys want to be doing. But it doesn't make you any safer. 
[237]And then they will come after me with everything they have... So this is what we do. And the times will get better and safer. They will. So go. You are strong just by going. Stronger in fact. 
[238]Peter. 
[239]I need to speak with you. 
[240]This has gotten out of control... There was a guy with a gun at my house. 
[241]My wife and children were home at the time. 
[242]Yes. I managed to chase him off. 
[243]I need to know who is doing this. 
[244]It's one thing to come after my trucks and drivers... and to steal from me... but this... it's different. 
[245]Have you ever dealt with anything like this? 
[246]I refuse to live my life that way. I won't do it... I am going to ask for a meeting. 
[247]Anyone with more than 20k of storage. Can I count on you being there? 
[248]Monday. 
[249]Hold that... it's not done yet... you may be hearing from me.  
[250]Thank you for seeing me. I want more than this... 
[251]And you have. 
[252]But it's not. 
[253]Thank you. 
[254]Joanne it's me. What are you talking about... what shots? 
[255]I need to make sure you know that we had nothing to do with this. It's not the way I do business. In fact I have been warning my men against doing this sort of thing. It is terrible for me. 
[256]Yes. 
[257]No... but I'll find him. 
[258]Arthur. 
[259]
[260]Thank you for coming... This is not right. 
[261]What can I do? 
[262]And you are aware of the position this is putting me in? 
[263]I paid off my first loan to you eleven years ago. 
[264]Do you remember the term on that loan? 
[265]I had seven years to pay you back. 
[266]Do you know how long it took me to pay you off? 
[267]Six and a half. 
[268]I put 40 percent down as a deposit on this. It's all we had. 
[269]None of it is true. 
[270]May? 
[271]It does matter, that you know we didn't do this. 
[272]I'll find it. 
[273]Yes. 
[274]We're looking for him. 
[275]Of course not. 
[276]No... I'm not... They're out. 
[277]The bank. 
[278]It means we need to find the money somewhere else. 
[279]I'll figure it out. 
[280]You are thirteen years old. What are you doing? Your mother asks you an hour ago to help her get out of the house smoothly and you are acting like an... 
[281]What? What? What are you talking about? 
[282]I'm not sure who the hell you think you are, but you don't talk to me that way... You are in serious danger of becoming a rich little spoiled brat and I can tell you from experience there is nothing worse in the world than a rich little girl who thinks the whole world revolves around her. 
[283]First off I don't walk around like I am saving anything. I chose this business because I looked at the world and said `What's the last bill people stop paying every month when they are low on cash?' `Cause that's a business I want to be in. `Cause failure wasn't much of an option for me. I lived in reality... not whatever this world is you are living in. And we help people stay warm... which isn't all that bad.  Maybe you've got grander ambitions but for now this is how you eat, sleep, and get all dressed up... So you better shape the fuck up and NEVER speak to me like this again! 
[284]Hey. 
[285]How's it coming? 
[286]That was a good year. 
[287]Well it was for me...how is it? 
[288]I got us a three more days... and one piece... from Saul. But we're still about a million short. 
[289]First thing. 
[290]Probably. 
[291]Of course. 
[292]You should get to bed. 
[293]I love you. 
[294]I know. 
[295]I know. 
[296]Sometimes. 
[297]I have always been much more scared of failure than anything else. 
[298]It wasn't always like this. 
[299]Not today... but by the end of the week... maybe. 
[300]Good... 
[301]That does not have to be true. 
[302]I'm gonna try to get us a little more time. 
[303]Thank you for seeing me. 
[304]I need more time. 
[305]I know our agreement doesn't allow for that. But... I need more time. 
[306]Thank you for asking. Many, many reasons. 
[307]Yes... it is. 
[308]Thank you. 
[309]I talked to the Hasid, I got us three days. 
[310]I don't know. 
[311]Felons can't vote. 
[312]This plea has me... 
[313]I would never take this. 
[314]Who? 
[315]Of course he is. 
[316]All the drivers could have us on scales. Why? 
[317]He would never do that. 
[318]Thank you for letting me in. 
[319]Have you seen Julian? 
[320]We need to find him. 
[321]I am worried about him. 
[322]You know we were going to support him. I do not know why he ran. 
[323]I know. 
[324]Yes. Well this time that hasn't worked out. 
[325]Do what? 
[326]I know. It makes me very sad, because he is a very talented young man. But there are some decisions that you cannot come back from. I need to know where he is. And I need him to turn himself in. His actions are hurting me and my business. And I refuse to let other people's weaknesses hurt me. I don't know how it has come to this, but it has. If he does the right thing I will help to take care of his responsibilities. You and your family. When you see him. Tell him this. Please. 
[327]Does he have any money? 
[328]Money? Has he taken money out of your bank account? 
[329]You need to start looking into these things. It is very important that we find him safely. 
[330]Stop! Stop running away! Andrew! He's coming your way! 
[331]I understand why you lied, but it is not smart. 
[332]There are other people looking for him. I am as good an option as he has. Know this. 
[333]Thank you both for agreeing to meet with me. 
[334]I think we have met before but I didn't realize you were Saul's Granddaughter. 
[335]I'm sorry to ask but how old are you? 
[336]Oh. 
[337]Yes. 
[338]Yes. 
[339]I understand. And I hope that your Grandfather was able to communicate to you how much I have always respected him. And it was only out of respect for the business he had built, and because I knew of his reservations and feelings about your uncles and your father that I made those offers. 
[340]But, I am not here to offer to buy your company. 
[341]As I'm sure you will soon learn some years are good... others not so. I am in contract with a significant hard deposit at risk to purchase the old Bayfront terminal. 
[342]And due to circumstances beyond my control my bank has left me at the altar. 
[343]So, I am here, hat in hand, looking for a loan. I certainly expect the terms to be in your favor as I could not be at a weaker place. But, if your Grandfather trusted you with his company, I would be willing to trust you as my lien holder. 
[344]I need $500,000. 
[345]Of course. 
[346]Okay. Thank you. 
[347]Tonight? Oh yes, of course. 
[348]Stop... 
[349]Peter... thank you... That may be true. 
[350]But over the last six months 110,000 gallons of fuel has been stolen from my family and I. Now the reason we asked Bill to get you all here is because the people in this room are the only people within two hundred miles of here who have the ability to purchase and store that kind of quantity. So... no matter what bullshit you have been telling each other one of you... or two... or three... has been allowing this to happen by buying this from these cowards or worse yet hiring these guys just to do it. And profiting from it. So what I am saying is... Stop! Now. Have some pride in what you do and stop. 
[351]Hey. 
[352]How's it coming? 
[353]That was a good year. 
[354]Well it was for me...how is it? 
[355]I got us a three more days... and one piece... from Saul. But we're still about a million short. 
[356]First thing. 
[357]Probably. 
[358]How are the girls? I feel like I haven't seen them in days. 
[359]Of course. 
[360]I know. 
[361]We should get to bed. 
[362]I love you. 
[363]Your friend is dead... who do you work for. 
[364]Stop... just stop. 
[365]Jimmy, can you give me a minute? 
[366]Thank you. 
[367]I've just come to collect that check you owe me. 
[368]The one for $213,000. 
[369]That's how much has been taken from me over the last six months. 
[370]Your Far Rockaway facility bought a load of fuel last week off one of my stolen trucks. 
[371]I was standing on top of one of my hi-jacked trucks a couple weeks ago thinking about the cowards who did this when I remembered I had bought the load of fuel off a friend's tanker straight from Texas. As I'm sure you know Texas #4 is marked. But that was just one load, so every truck that has left my lot for the last two weeks has been marked with dye that I've put in... And luckily four more of my trucks got jacked since.... My guess is there are at least 4600 gallons of marked fuel in your small tank right now. 
[372]I said...213,000. 
[373]Okay. 
[374]My goal was to have you out of business by the end of next year. And if you're this fucking desperate it doesn't seem like it will even take that long. 
[375]I don't care. 
[376]When you find out who else it was you can get them to pay you back the difference. Kinda makes you miss having your father around? But I need the whole lot tomorrow or the feds will be at your doorstep by noon. 
[377]You look good out there. 
[378]I didn't either... I didn't mean to take you away. 
[379]Of course. You've grown. 
[380]I know... but you have. 
[381]The girls at this place... they are so beautiful? 
[382]I don't know how you get anything done around here. 
[383]I'm in a bit of a rough patch. 
[384]It happens. 
[385]Good... 
[386]That will be your burden... 
[387]Not having had one. 
[388]I need your signature on this. 
[389]I need to take out a short term mortgage on our apartment building. 
[390]210. 
[391]I'm up against it a bit. It will be fine. 
[392]Thank you... It's good to see your face. 
[393]I love you too. 
[394]Yes. 
[395]I am. 
[396]The one guy didn't make it out of the crash, and the other guy disappeared. 
[397]Thank you. And thanks for seeing me. 
[398]I need a loan. 
[399]No shit... but I'm here. 
[400]Six hundred thousand. 
[401]Yes... but if I don't get it... 
[402]The terminal. 
[403]You'll get your money. 
[404]I know that. 
[405]Yeah. 
[406]Yes. 
[407]Yeah. 
[408]He seemed good... But the girls up at that place are... 
[409]I can tell you the girls didn't look like that where I went to school... 
[410]How are we here? 
[411]Yeah. 
[412]We can probably pull it off. Three different parties... it'll be a mess... and the terms... Peter suddenly showed me his true colors. 
[413]I spent my whole life trying not to become a gangster... 
[414]...And now... on the biggest deal in my career they will all control me. 
[415]What is this? 
[416]Whose? 
[417]How much is in it? 
[418]What does that mean? 
[419]Where did it come from? 
[420]Where did it come from? 
[421]What do you expect me to do with this? 
[422]Is it clean? 
[423]It means if you walked into the office of the people who have been trying to put us in jail right now and slapped a check from that account down on their desk would it push me further into hell or help to get me out? 
[424]That's a fucking bullshit answer. 
[425]Well it sounds like you should take this money and keep it right where it is... because I'm going to pretend that we never had this conversation. And you can use that when they drag me off to jail! 
[426]I'll get it done. And it won't be as a cheat. 
[427]You stole from me! 
[428]We'll use the money... your money. It's the smart play. 
[429]I know... 
[430]I guess there is still some fuel in two of the tanks... they gave us a fair price on it. 
[431]To you too. Did you know...about the money? 
[432]You should have told me. 
[433]No. 
[434]I did. 
[435]I thought you said you threw that into the river? 
[436]I see that. 
[437]Nowhere easy. 
[438]It wasn't meant to be. 
[439]I know what you wanted. But you need to forget that. You are looking backward. Only look forward, that is what you can control. 
[440]Yes. 
[441]No. 
[442]Julian. 
[443]I will. 
[444]We call the police. 
[445]Yes! 
[446]I did. 
[447]Yeah. For a while I thought he was... it's just... 
[448]You really do have to be lucky. 
[449]I was right there... I couldn't help myself. 
[450]Have you found the driver? 
[451]You'll find him. 
[452]Well, thank you for coming. I wanted to make sure this was handled correctly. 
[453]I'm not sure how I got here. 
[454]So... I should tell you that I won't be able to take that deal you offered. There is no way I would ever accept a felony charge for anything we've done. 
[455]I am not a felon. 
[456]But I also can't have you digging around my life and keeping this hanging around my neck for the next ten years. I love fighting a good battle but this... it's very bad for my business.

[458]Good. 
[459]It looks that way. 
[460]For a very long time. 
[461]Within my business it has that potential. 
[462]Yes. 
[463]Yes, I have. 
[464]It doesn't feel that way... But please know that I have always chosen the path that was the most right. 
[465]Yes. 
[466]The result is never in question for me. Just what path do I take to get there. And I have never questioned my path. There is always one that is most right. And that is what this is.

dialogues.ANDREW WALSH:
[1]So how are we this morning?

dialogues.PETER FORENTE:
[1]So you made the move? 
[2]So I heard about your rig getting picked off again. 
[3]We should probably get together to discuss this and go over some of the preventative measures that we've been taking. We haven't had an incident since November. It doesn't do any of us any good to have this kind of attention brought to us. 
[4]So I think I may have seen one of your new trucks the other day. 
[5]Out near here, at the Miller Road diner? 
[6]The driver looked like a member of the Hitler Youth. I haven't seen a teamster that blond and blue-eyed since I was a kid. 
[7]That's new territory for you, no? 
[8]Which one is yours? 
[9]She's beautiful. 
[10]Welcome to the neighborhood. You should be proud. 
[11]Yes. 
[12]It's a pretty cool machine, isn't it?

[18]Abel... 
[19]Yes.

They ended up just leaving and we never found out who it was. But after that we moved to a fortress just like this. And those guys who let you in. They are here to shoot anyone who isn't invited. 
[22]Who? 
[23]Yes... When are you closing on the terminal? 
[24]Congratulations. 
[25]Well, good luck. 
[26]I know you do. My father is in jail... as you know. And I have always wanted to conduct myself differently than he did. 
[27]Almost exclusively, yes. But I know why he did what he did. Because at the time it's easier. 
[28]Yes it is. You are a good man. I will see what I can find out. This isn't good for any of us. 
[29]Um... Abel... we had a chance to meet for a little bit before you got here and... of course everyone in this room is fully capable of lying to their own mothers on their deathbeds, but... the conclusion we have come to... I should say we are fairly convinced after a very frank conversation... that these guys who are doing this... that they don't actually work for anyone in this room. As you know there are many other smaller providers in the area that might be responsible who are not here tonight. 
[30]Well here he is. The caped crusader.

You're good at what you do, probably better than us, and I accept that. But this would be different. I don't want you to be in this position. We are not nice people to borrow three quarters of million dollars from. 
[41]Let's sleep on this. Both of us.
dialogues.BILL O'LEARY:
[1]I'm ok. Can't say I'm used to making house calls like this anymore though. 
[2]That's alright. You've got bigger things to worry about. So, I can't have this situation with your guys continuing. 
[3]Your drivers. 
[4]So let them protect themselves, that would stop all this very quickly. 
[5]They are picking on your men because they are just sitting there... weak. 
[6]It's quite simple for me: I can't have my drivers getting hit like this. It looks like I can't protect them. 
[7]I can. And will. Because of all my job descriptions that is the one I consider most sacred. 
[8]It will stop immediately. 
[9]You seem to be under pressure from many sides right now... which I understand. Trust me I understand. So let me think this through. But whatever decision I make on this, it stands. Those men show up every morning for you because I tell them to. It's important for you to realize that these are very dangerous times, and we need to adapt. It's not like when we were driving.

[11]It's not always as simple as it appears.

[15]What's to understand?

[17]So talk to him. You need to protect yourself. This is very serious. Just know that. 
[18]What does that mean? 
[19]Are you kidding me with this? 
[20]Every driver in your fleet gets a handgun. 
[21]By Friday.

[23]I don't fucking know... 
[24]Not well. 
[25]I can see that. 
[26]What's to understand? 
[27]It's not illegal if I say it isn't. 
[28]My responsibility is to provide safe and timely passage of goods and products into and around this city. And because of this situation it is appearing to those whose opinions I am concerned with, that I can't do that right now. That can not and will not continue. 
[29]So talk to him. You need to protect yourself. As a company. 
[30]This is very serious. Just know that. 
[31]What does that mean?

[22]It may ruin me.
dialogues.ARTHUR LEWIS:
[1]Anna, you look amazing as always. 
[2]Gentlemen. Do you know Ian Thompson? One of our new VP's. 
[3]So how are you? 
[4]Yes I heard about that... if you stay in business long enough it's bound to happen eventually.

[6]We've always been there with you and know that we will continue to be. 
[7]Abel. 
[8]I wanted to come and talk to you in person... We aren't going to be able to show up for you on Monday. We can't do the loan. 
[9]I wanted to let you know as soon as possible so that you could try to put something else together. 
[10]I know. 
[11]Nothing... The loan review committee met this afternoon and won't meet again for two weeks. 
[12]I am. 
[13]I know. 
[14]I don't. 
[15]Seven months? 
[16]I'm sorry. 
[17]You now have three separate serious pending legal cases against you. One with sixteen counts of misconduct ranging from fraud to tax evasion. And then in the middle of our meeting today I get a report saying you had armed your entire fleet of drivers which led to a shoot-out on the 59th Street Bridge. 
[18]That may be. 
[19]It doesn't matter. 
[20]I do... I do. But it doesn't matter, I can't do anything. I'm sorry. 
[21]I know you will.
dialogues.JOSEPH:
[1]So why is it you want this land? 
[2]It has been difficult for you to get me here, no? Over a year? 
[3]There are many like it around? And thanks to all these tests you paid for, we now know it is as much of a mess below the ground as it is above. My people have looked at your books, I know this is a lot of money for you, so why have you kept on us so... just for this ugly and polluted little piece of the earth. 
[4]So it is just proximity? 
[5]And what's that? 
[6]Well, I am in the garment business so I appreciate that sentiment. But I inherited this land from my uncle. Sadly he had no children of his own. He was the one that let them build these tanks here. So this place can do little for me... in fact thanks to all those tests you've done it may be a liability. As you know I offered to lease the site to you at a fair price, but you were not interested? 
[7]Why not? 
[8]I can see that. 
[9]Yes. This contract here, your lawyers have fully reviewed it? 
[10]And you have brought the money?  So you realize you have only thirty days to close this transaction? 
[11]No extensions, no... contingencies whatsoever. 
[12]I want you to know this up front. I am a very fair man but I believe in honoring contracts. You will fulfill your end of this contract and the property is yours. If you can't we will keep your money and will sell it to your competitor who has been chasing us almost as badly as you have. I like you, but know that the only reason I am choosing you is because of the favorable terms of this contract. So this is business... and when you sign this.... 
[13]Well then, let's see this money, and then I will sign these papers. 
[14]Of course. 
[15]Of course you do. 
[16]Why? 
[17]It's a difficult time to do business. 
[18]I'll give you three more days. Then it's over. 
[19]Mazel Tov.
dialogues.LOUIS SERVIDIO:
[1]Whoa, whoa, whoa! Take it easy there. 
[2]Okay, man. 
[3]Watch it now, man. You're going to hurt someone. 
[4]Where are you? 
[5]Where is he? 
[6]Get the car! 
[7]Run for it! 
[8]Oh, there he is. Had to be the hero eh? 
[9]Couldn't just let us take the truck. 
[10]Hey man relax... calm down. Did they see you come in here? 
[11]Did they or not? 
[12]Alright, there's a door down here about four more flights. Don't go out there, that's the street. Go down about two more flights after that and you'll come out below the bridge. They won't be there. 
[13]You're welcome. 
[14]Please. Please. 
[15]You know I could never tell you that. 
[16]This was it anyway. Okay... Okay. 
[17]Thank you.
dialogues.LUISA:
[1]No. 
[2]I will tell him. 
[3]Of course. 
[4]No. 
[5]I know. 
[6]So am I. 
[7]He was scared. 
[8]He has always wanted to make you proud. You know that right? 
[9]No... How did you do it? 
[10]This. 
[11]Success... that's all he wanted. 
[12]I will. 
[13]I'm sorry? 
[14]I don't know?
dialogues.ELIAS:
[1]I didn't know you were coming. 
[2]We're done. 
[3]Thanks for coming. 
[4]You saw me a month ago. 
[5]Yes. 
[6]I don't. 
[7]Yes... 
[8]I know. 
[9]What will? 
[10]What is it? 
[11]That thing isn't worth more than 150 grand though? 
[12]Since when do you need to be taking out sucker mortgages for 200 grand? 
[13]I love you.
dialogues.BEAT COP:
[1]Excuse me? 
[2]Is it yours? 
[3]Well, I'm sorry about that. Once the owner or an owner's representative files the claim form in Corona she's yours... again. 
[4]Yes. 
[5]I'm sorry? 
[6]
[7]No need, these guys always wear gloves. 
[8]I'm not exactly sure, I just got here at four. My shift is actually up. 
[9]Sorry. 
[10]Why did they want it?
dialogues.SALES STUDENT ALEX:
[1]What noise? 
[2]Why? 
[3]Good. A bit nervous. I'm heading out on my first calls alone today. 
[4]Hi Mrs. Rose. I'm Alex with Standard Heating Oil, we had an appointment. 
[5]Now as I mentioned on the phone this is a 17 point inspection that will help us to decipher if our maintenance plan will improve your efficiency. 
[6]Great. 
[7]Mr. Rose, I am Alex with Standard Heating Oil. 
[8]I was just showing your wife the results of my inspection. Should we head upstairs to run through some numbers? 
[9]Of course. 
[10]Tea would be great.
dialogues.CONTRACTOR:
[1]Hello? 
[2]Thank you. 
[3]We are. 
[4]I am. 
[5]I hope so. 
[6]That may be true. 
[7]Yes. 
[8]It's being replaced, as I mentioned to your wife, that was an error on our part. Congratulations on your home.
dialogues.LORAINE LEFKOWITZ:
[1]I understand. 
[2]Oh. 
[3]I see. 
[4]I'm sorry. 
[5]Would you give us a minute. 
[6]We can offer you the 500k at 20 percent for a year. 
[7]And we would need a five-year straight wholesale holding agreement for 250,000 gallons a year at your new facility. 
[8]So, I guess we will see you tonight?
dialogues.LORRAINE LEFKOWITZ:
[1]Of course. 
[2]I am. 
[3]I'm 23. 
[4]My Grandfather didn't trust any of his children to run the business. 
[5]I know that you tried to buy the company from my Grandfather several times. 
[6]His goal was to stay healthy long enough to be able to give the company to me. Which he thankfully did. 
[7]So, while I appreciate your visit we are still not for sale.
